info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mecklenburg, southeastern Gaston and central York Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of York, or near Newport, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, York, Southwest Charlotte, Belmont, Tega Cay, Newport, Steele Creek, Carowinds, Lake Wylie and Southpark Mall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
